Description: Rim sherd of Attic black-figured pottery skyphos; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; exterior: black band at rim; below, narrow dilute band; below, black-figure decoration consisting of draped youth (head and shoulders with added red on himation remaining) to right.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 361, no. B472)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0343) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 96, pl. III, no. 13)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
